author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan is preparing to kick off its most expansive annual military drills ever — underscoring President Lai Ching-te’s drive to protect the self-run democracy from China’s assertiveness.
title: Taiwan Holds Most Expansive Annual Drills Ever to Counter China

author: Erik Larson
description: A group of small businesses that won an order finding President Donald Trump’s sweeping global tariffs illegal urged a federal appeals court to uphold that decision and block the trade levies.
title: Trump Tariff ‘Blank Check’ Must Be Curbed, Appeals Court Told

author: Molly Smith
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy editor Molly Smith looks at the details of the last jobs report and what it may mean for the midterm elections. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Job Market Cooling May Be an Early Omen for Midterms

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US slapped sanctions on individuals and companies linked to a scheme that involves recruiting North Koreans to pose as American tech workers and help fund Kim Jong Un’s regime.
title: US Sanctions Target North Korean Fake-Tech-Worker Scheme

author: Monique Vanek
description: South Africa’s finance minister said work on lowering the inflation target is “progressing well” but cautioned against rushing the decision.
title: South Africa Finance Head Cautions Against Rushing New Inflation Goal

author: Greg Stohr, Zoe Tillman
description: The US Supreme Court let President Donald Trump move ahead with plans to dramatically reduce the size of the federal government, lifting a court order that had blocked 19 federal departments and agencies from slashing their workforces.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Proceed With Broad Workforce Cuts

author: Stephanie Lai, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said he would meet again with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday to further efforts to secure a ceasefire in Gaza following new momentum after a US proposal to temporarily halt the fighting.
title: Trump to Meet Netanyahu Again in Push for Gaza Ceasefire

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s National Treasury is worried that the US’s proposed 30% tariff could hit tax revenues and is modeling the impact it may have on the nation’s budget.
title: South Africa to Model Budget Impact of US Proposed 30% Tariff

author: Anna J Kaiser, Michael Smith
description: Florida enacted legislation allowing non-competes of up to four years, handing a victory to Citadel’s Ken Griffin, who pushed for the policy.
title: Ken Griffin-Backed Florida Bill for Non-Competes Becomes Law

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: President Javier Milei’s approval rating and positive image remained well above domestic peers in June even as Argentines became increasingly worried about the job market after unemployment rose earlier this year.
title: Milei Approval Rating Holds as Argentines Worry More About Jobs

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said his administration is weighing whether to take control of the city of Washington, DC, to help combat crime, in a move that would represent a dramatic upheaval to the capital’s half-century of home rule.
title: Trump Says He’s Weighing Federal Takeover of Washington, DC

author: Myles Miller, Laura Nahmias
description: A former high-ranking New York City police official alleged in a lawsuit that he was forced out of his job for raising concerns about the actions of an anti-crime unit created by Mayor Eric Adams.
title: Ex-NYPD Chief Says Warnings Over Mayor’s Policies Led to Ouster

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is considering setting up a €100 billion ($117 billion) fund to support Ukraine as its war with Russia following Moscow’s full-scale invasion shows no signs of ending.
title: EU Weighs €100 Billion Fund for Ukraine in Next Budget Proposal

author: Josh Wingrove, Ryan Chua, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump reiterated his displeasure with Vladimir Putin over the war in Ukraine and confirmed he’s sending more defensive weapons to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s government, sweeping aside an earlier pause by the Pentagon.
title: Trump Slams Putin Again as He Backs More Weapons for Ukraine

author: Ellen Milligan, Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron urged the UK to recognize the state of Palestine in an address to the British parliament that emphasized the need for cooperation amid Middle East tensions and uncertainty over US support.
title: Macron Pushes Starmer to Recognize Palestine on Visit to UK

author: Kristina Peterson
description: Consumers may soon be paying more for fresh tomatoes as a decades-long deal with Mexico expires in less than a week, absent a last-minute deal or extension.
title: A Tomato Fight With Mexico Is Set to Boost US Prices Nearly 10%

author: Joe Deaux, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump said he planned to implement a 50% duty on copper imports as part of a set of looming sectoral tariffs, while also indicating he could offer pharmaceutical manufacturers at least a year before applying a crippling 200% tariff on their foreign-made products.
title: Trump Says He’ll Set 50% Copper Tariff, Wait Year on Drug Levies

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: France’s finance minister said he feared a “mass exodus” of equity trading to London if he hadn’t provided clarity to banks about the application of new dividend tax rules.
title: French Minister Feared Equity Trading Exodus to UK After Dividend Tax Rule Change

author: Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump said Jerome Powell should “resign immediately” if allegations from critics that the Federal Reserve chairman misled lawmakers about renovations at the central bank’s headquarters proved true.
title: Trump Says Powell Should ‘Resign Immediately’ If Congress Misled

author: Jorge Valero, Benedikt Kammel, Stefan Nicola
description: As the European Union nears a trade deal with the US, its negotiators are focusing on protecting key industries from massive tariffs set to hit the bloc’s exports as soon as Aug. 1.
title: EU to Protect Airbus in US Trade Deal as Ferrari Set to Lose Out

author: Aaron Kirchfeld, Benedikt Kammel
description: A rift between French and German companies over control of a next-generation fighter jet risks dooming the project, Germany’s aviation lobby said, putting in doubt a marquee program just as the region fortifies its defense capabilities.
title: Franco-German Rift Risks Dooming Next Fighter Jet, BDLI Says

author: Catarina Saraiva
description: The Trump administration’s curbs on immigration and ramped-up deportations will lower US economic growth by almost a full percentage point this year, according to a study from the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas.
title: US Immigration Curbs to Hit Economy Hard in 2025, Fed Study Says

author: Tom Rees
description: UK officials were kept in the dark over a crucial report detailing major cultural failings at the statistics body that contributed to the breakdown of official unemployment data.
title: UK Officials Kept in Dark About Problems Plaguing Economic Data

author: Erica Yokoyama, Takashi Umekawa
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is planning to visit Japan next week for the 2025 World Expo in Osaka, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Treasury Secretary Bessent to Visit Japan Next Week for Expo

author: Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump said he would not offer any extensions to a new August 1 deadline for nations to begin paying so-called reciprocal tariffs.
title: Trump Says Aug. 1 Tariff Deadline Won’t Be Extended

author: Sri Taylor
description: Philadelphia’s streets and sidewalks are piling up with garbage after the union of municipal employees went on strike in a city that is already facing acute budget pressures.
title: Philadelphia Trash Piles Up as Garbage Workers’ Strike Drags On

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Someone pretending to be Secretary of State Marco Rubio used AI-generated voice technology and a fake Signal account to contact foreign officials and at least one member of Congress, the latest case of impostors mimicking senior US officials.
title: Rubio Impersonator Uses AI, Signal to Contact Foreign Officials

author: Simone Iglesias, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wants to deepen trade ties with India, the world’s most populous nation. The question as he prepares to host Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Brasilia on Tuesday is how to go about it.
title: Brazil’s Lula Hosts Modi in Bid to Turn India Into a Major Trade Partner

author: Ilena Peng
description: The Trump administration is tightening its grip on foreign ownership of farmland amid continuing concerns over Chinese investment in America’s heartland.
title: US Acts Against Foreign Ownership of Farmland Amid China Tension

author: Tom Rees
description: Britain’s budget watchdog warned of a £12 billion ($16.3 billion) blow to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves from higher welfare spending if the government fails to get a handle on soaring health benefits.
title: Budget Watchdog Warns on UK Welfare Costs After Policy U-Turns

author: Alex Morales
description: UK doctors voted overwhelmingly in favor of fresh strikes over pay in the latest setback to Prime Minister Keir Starmer less than a year after the Labour government awarded them a sizable wage increase to end a previous round of damaging industrial action.
title: UK Doctors Vote in Favor of New Strikes in Setback to Starmer

author: Julian Lee
description: Refining runs are rising faster than production, eating into exports
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Slide to the Lowest Since February

author: Jenny Leonard
description: On “Liberation Day” on April 2, Donald Trump gushed about how trade was finally going to tilt in America’s favor after decades of its workers and companies being “plundered.” For the president, unfettered tariffs would soon make the US “an entirely different country.”
title: Latest Tariff Pause Shows Limits of Trump’s Frenzied Dealmaking

author: Rene Vollgraaff
description: The United Nations denounced the use of lethal force in clashes between Kenyan police and protesters, which killed least 15 people, saying those responsible must be held to account.
title: UN Criticizes Lethal Force in Kenya That Killed 15 Protesters

author: Tarek El-Tablawy
description: A blaze at a key downtown Cairo telephone exchange left at least four people dead and another 27 injured, cutting off network services and forcing the local stock exchange to cancel Tuesday’s trading session.
title: Deadly Fire in Cairo Telecom Hub Causes Widespread Disruptions

author: Michal Kubala, Max Ramsay
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen accused China of distorting trade and limiting access for European firms two weeks ahead of a summit between the economic powers.
title: EU Chief Demands China Address Trade Imbalance as Tensions Flare

author: Dan Williams
description: Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu nominated Trump for a Nobel prize.
title: Trump Seeks an Elusive Peace Dividend in Gaza

author: Michael Nienaber, Arne Delfs
description: Germany summoned China’s ambassador over accusations that a military plane was endangered by a Chinese warship.
title: Germany Summons Chinese Envoy After Laser Targeted Plane

author: Maria Clara Cobo, Nazmul Ahasan
description: Mental health providers, the fastest-growing industry in the US since the start of the pandemic, risk a sharp reversal of fortune as President Donald Trump seeks to eliminate billions of dollars in funding that enabled their expansion.
title: US Mental Health Jobs Boom Faces Sudden Stop as Trump Cuts Funds

author: Modou Joof
description: Gambian lawmakers rejected a new draft constitution that imposed presidential term limits, but contained a loophole that would have allowed President Adama Barrow to run for re-election after his current five-year term ends in 2027.
title: Gambia Rejects New Constitution That Allows Barrow to Extend His Rule

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil justified Germany’s massive ramp-up in military spending by arguing it’s essential to face down the threat from Vladimir Putin’s Russia and prevent German children ever having to experience war.
title: German Finance Chief Says Putin Threat Justifies Defense Buildup

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Fanático de “The West Wing” y enemigo acérrimo de todo lo “woke”, Santiago Caputo revoluciona la política argentina.
title: El misterioso asesor que maneja redes, discursos y poder en la Argentina de Javier Milei

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Santiago Caputo is upending Argentine politics amid rumored tension with the libertarian president’s sister ahead of a crucial midterm vote.
title: Milei’s Secret Weapon Is an Anti-Woke Devotee of ‘The West Wing’

author: Ben Sills
description: Unlocking a full picture of Russia’s demographic situation is becoming increasingly hard after the state stopped publishing monthly statistics amid the Kremlin’s war against Ukraine.
title: Russia Locks Up Population Data With War in Ukraine in Its Fourth Year

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said there’s the prospect that the US may lower a planned 30% tariff on goods in ongoing talks with Washington, as he challenged its calculation of the new levy.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Sees Scope to Lower US Tariff in Talks

author: Philip Glamann
description: China complained to India after Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent birthday wishes to the Dalai Lama, a spat that risks complicating efforts by the two sides to mend ties.
title: China Criticizes India for Modi’s Birthday Wishes to Dalai Lama

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: Investigation shows how Chinese suppliers have been key for Russia’s war against Ukraine
title: Russian Drone Documents Draw Line From China to Ukraine’s Skies

author: James Mayger, Michael Heath
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese plans to travel to China from this weekend, seeking to strengthen ties with his country’s largest trading partner while its top security ally US aims to check Beijing’s presence in Asia.
title: Australia’s Albanese Heads to China as Trump Stresses Alliance

author: Colum Murphy
description: A European business group in China has criticized Beijing’s retaliatory measures targeting medical device makers from the European Union, saying the move worsens ties between the two economic powers.
title: European Group Decries China’s New Medical Device Restrictions

author: Manolo Serapio Jr
description: The Philippine government has summoned China’s envoy to Manila, expressing concern over Beijing’s recent rare move to sanction a former senator who it accused of improper behavior on issues related to China.
title: Philippines Summons Chinese Envoy After Ex-Senator Sanctioned

author: Adrian Wooldridge
description: The UK is failing to produce a competent governing class.
title: Can Anyone in Britain Run a Government?

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria is set to clear the final hurdle to becoming the 21st member of the euro zone next year as European Union finance ministers meet Tuesday to sign off on its bid.
title: EU to Give Final Nod to Bulgaria’s Euro-Zone Entry Next Year

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: Senior clerics and military figures are looking to leverage Iran's nationalist history to try and forge unity in the polarized country.
title: Iran’s Khamenei Looks to the Past For Route to Regime Survival

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand remains optimistic about securing a lower tariff rate than the 36% levy announced by President Donald Trump based on an offer to bring down import tax on most US goods to zero, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.
title: Thailand Confident of Securing Lower US Tariff With Trade Offers

author: Allyson Versprille, Myles Miller
description: US travelers may soon no longer have to worry about removing their shoes to go through standard airport security checkpoints, a change that will likely speed up screening for airline passengers.
title: TSA Set to Let Travelers Keep Shoes on Through Airport Security

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia will continue to engage with the US for a “mutually beneficial” trade agreement after President Donald Trump threatened to impose a 25% tariff on the Southeast Asian nation, higher than the 24% announced in April.
title: Malaysia to Continue Engaging with US on Tariffs: Trade Ministry

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Asia’s export-dependent economies received more time but little reprieve, as US President Donald Trump shifted his tariff deadline to Aug. 1 and rounded the rates he’s set for Japan, South Korea and others.
title: Asia Stuck in Trump’s Tariff Sights as Deadline Shifts to Aug. 1

author: Stephanie Lai, Akayla Gardner, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he’d ship more weapons to Ukraine, marking an apparent reversal after the Pentagon halted flows of some air-defense missiles and artillery shells to the country.
title: Trump Promises More Weapons for Ukraine and Criticizes Putin
